content: oree shawl oree shoth from the broken kingdoms is one of my favourite fantasy protagonists sensible and no-nonsense she s as refreshing as fresh mint the vibrant colours of hawthorne remind me of the colours of magic which oree is cursed/blessed to see i like to think oree would wear this shawl which is lacy enough to be versatile and thick enough to be warm materials 100-200g of a bouncy superwash yarn used large knitpicks hawthorne sport multi 80% superwash fine highland wool 20% polyamide 236m 258 yd /100g 2 skeins in goose hollow used small knitpicks hawthorne multi 80% superwash fine highland wool 20% polyamide 326m 357 yd /100g 1 skein in goose hollow hook size whichever needed to obtain gauge used large 4 25mm/g hook used small 3 75mm/f hook gauge gauge is unimportant to this pattern use a hook size that gives you a soft fabric with a nice drape notions needle for weaving in ends stitch markers for first last and centre stitches notes this pattern can be used with any weight of yarn use one hook size larger than recommended on the ball band for a light bouncy fabric or the recommended size for a thick thermal wrap handpainted yarns can vary dramatically by skein even within the same colourway if you have different coloured skeins i recommend using one skein for the mesh and another for the half-double_crochet or working to the end of one skein and switching on row 6 or 13 for a tonal effect glossary chain chain single_crochet single_crochet english double_crochet chain space chain-space made by the chain 3 on the previous row half_double_crochet half_double_crochet english half-treble_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch directions row 1 chain 2 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook chain 3 single_crochet in same space 3 times row 2 chain 1 single_crochet in first chain space chain 3 single_crochet in same space chain 3 single_crochet in the next chain space chain 3 single_crochet in the same chain space the chain space just made is the centre chain 3 single_crochet in last chain space twice row 3-5 chain 1 single_crochet in first chain space chain 3 single_crochet in same space * chain 3 single_crochet in next chain chain 1 3 single_crochet in chain space 3 single_crochet in each chain space to centre 5 single_crochet in centre chain space 3 single_crochet in each chain space to end row 7 chain 2 2 single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet in last stitch row 8-11 chain 2 2 half_double_crochet in first stitch half_double_crochet in each stitch across to centre 3 half_double_crochet in centre stitch
